title: Justice Department demands Google sell off Chrome in new filing
description: Following a court ruling that Google has abused its monopoly in search and online advertising, the judge in the case will consider proposed remedies from both the US Department of Justice as well as Google.The DOJ wants Judge Mehta to issue stiff penalties against Google's monopolies.The DOJ originally brought an antitrust action against Google in late 2023 over its deals with Apple and others to make Google Search the default search engine in other browsers and platforms.Judge Amit Mehta of the DC United States District Court ruled in August 2024 that Google is a monopolist. While it is not illegal for an entity to become a monopoly in its field, it is unlawful for a monopoly to limit consumer choice by creating barriers to fair competition. Continue Reading on AppleInsider | Discuss on our Forums

title: Two Apple Card Daily Cash bonus offers to entice new signups
description: Apple is offering an alternative to its existing $75 welcome bonus for new Apple Card users, it can provide up to $200 in cash back over ten months, but you'll have to act fast.If you haven't already, it's a good time to apply for an Apple Card.Apple has posted a second current bonus offer for its Apple Card, giving up to $200 cash back for users who apply for a new Apple Card and make 10 purchases per month on it. title: Ten years of Overcast: A new foundation
description: Today, on the tenth anniversary of Overcast 1.0, I‚Äôm happy to launch a complete rewrite and redesign of most of the iOS app, built to carry Overcast into the next decade ‚Äî and hopefully beyond. Like podcasts better than blog posts? Listen to ATP #596 for more! What‚Äôs new Much faster, more responsive, more reliable, and more accessible. Modern design, optimized for easily-reached controls on today‚Äôs phone sizes. Improvements throughout, such as undoing large seeks, new playlist-priority options, easier navigation, and more. What‚Äôs not Most features. Overcast is still Overcast! The audio engine. It‚Äôs the best part of Overcast, and still leads the industry in sound quality, silence skipping, and volume normalization. (More soon!) The business. I‚Äôm still a one-person operation, with no funding or external ownership, serving only my customers. My principles. I always want to make the best podcast app, and I‚Äôll never disrespect your time, attention, or privacy. What‚Äôs gone Streaming. Most big podcasts now use dynamic ad insertion, which causes bugs and problems for streaming playback.1 Downloading episodes completely before they begin playback is much more reliable. Tapping a non-downloaded episode will now open the playback screen, download it, then start playback. It works similarly to the way streaming did before, but playback begins after the download completes, not after a portion of it is buffered. On today‚Äôs fast networks, this usually only takes a few extra seconds. And in the near future, I‚Äôll be adding smarter options and more control over selective downloading of episodes to further improve the experience for people who don‚Äôt automatically download every episode. What‚Äôs next The last few missing features from the old app, such as Shortcuts support, storage management, and OPML. These are absent now, but will return soon. More options for downloading and deleting episodes. Upgrading the Apple Watch app to the new, faster sync engine. (The Watch app is currently unchanged from the previous one.) And, of course, more features, including some of your most-requested features over the last decade. Getting this rewrite out the door was a monumental task. Thank you for your patience as I work through this list! Why? Most of Overcast‚Äôs core code was 10 years old, which made it cumbersome or impossible to easily move with the times, adopt new iOS functionality, or add new features, especially as one person. That‚Äôs why there haven‚Äôt been many new features or changes in years. You saw it, and I saw it. I wasn‚Äôt able to serve my customers as well as I wanted. For Overcast to have a future, it needed a modern foundation for its second decade. I‚Äôve spent the past 18 months rebuilding most of the app with Swift, SwiftUI, Blackbird, and modern Swift concurrency. Now, development is rapidly accelerating. I‚Äôm more responsive, iterating more quickly, and ultimately making the app much better. Thank you all so much for the first decade of Overcast. Here‚Äôs to the next one. Dynamic ad insertion (DAI) splices ads into each download, and no two downloads are guaranteed to have the same number or duration of ads. So, for example, if the first half of an episode downloads, then the download fails, and it downloads the second half with another request, the combined audio may jump forward or back at the halfway mark, losing or repeating content.¬†‚Ü©Ô∏é

title: The Overcast Redesign: Part One
description: Overcast‚Äôs latest update (2022.2) brings the largest redesign in its nearly-eight-year history, plus many of the most frequently requested features and lots of under-the-hood improvements. I‚Äôm pretty proud of this one. For this first and largest phase of the redesign, I focused on the home screen, playlist screen, typography, and spacing. (I plan to revamp the now-playing and individual-podcast screens in a later update.) The home screen is radically different: Home screen, before (left) and after (right). Playlists now have strong visual identities for nicer and easier navigation. Each playlist has a customizable color, and a custom icon can be selected from over 3,000 SF Symbols to match modern iOS design and the other icons within Overcast. And playlists can be manually reordered with drag-and-drop. Recently played and newly published episodes can now be displayed on the home screen for quick access, much like the widget and CarPlay experience. Podcasts can now be pinned to the top of the home-screen list. Pinned podcasts can also be manually reordered with drag-and-drop. I‚Äôve also rethought the old stacked ‚ÄúPodcasts‚Äù and ‚ÄúPlayed Podcasts‚Äù sections to better match people‚Äôs needs and expectations. Now, the toggle atop the podcast list switches between three modes: podcasts with current episodes, all followed podcasts, and inactive podcasts (those that you don‚Äôt follow and therefore won‚Äôt get any more episodes from, or haven‚Äôt posted a new episode in a long time). The playlist screen‚Äôs structure remains mostly the same, while refining the design for the modern era: Playlist screen, before (left) and after (right). Here, it‚Äôs more apparent that I‚Äôve replaced the system San Francisco font with an alternate variant, San Francisco Rounded, to increase legibility and better match the personality of the app. I‚Äôve also added highly demanded features: By far, Overcast‚Äôs most-requested feature is a Mark as Played feature. That‚Äôs now available as a checkmark button on episode rows, as well as a left-side swipe action. The second-most-requested feature is a way to view all starred episodes. Special playlists for Starred, Downloaded, and In Progress can now be created. The light and dark themes now each have a customizable tint color from the modern iOS UI-color palette, including these favorites from beta testers: And throughout the app, I‚Äôve made tons of tweaks and bug fixes, including: Notifications and background downloads are now much more reliable. Episode downloads can now be individually deleted or re-downloaded. Links can now be opened in Safari. (under Nitpicky Details) Performance is now significantly better with very large playlists and collections. Fixed bugs with episode-duration detection, CarPlay lists, Mac-app sharing, and much more. So much is better in this update that I can‚Äôt even remember it all. Thank you so much to everyone who helped me beta-test this massive update. As always, Overcast is free in the App Store. Go get it!

title: Best iPhone 16 cases for 16 & Plus, 16 Pro & Pro Max, 16e
description: Macworld The first thing you should do after buying a new iPhone 16, be it an iPhone 16 Plus, Pro or Max, or the latest iPhone 16e, is to admire it and then swiftly cover it up. Buy yourself an iPhone 16 case to protect your precious mobile after splashing a ton of cash on it, and add some style to make your new handset more personal. Cases come in more shapes and size and with more functionality than you‚Äôd believe. We have hand tested the best to find the perfect case for your iPhone 16, 16 Plus, 16e, 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max. Best clear iPhone 16 cases Best-looking iPhone 16 cases Best protective cases for iPhone 16 Best leather and leather-alternative iPhone 16 cases Best iPhone 16 cases with wallet Best iPhone 16 case with camera accessories Best iPhone 16 case with built-in keyboard Best iPhone 16 cases with lanyards Best phone slings iPhone 16 case: Protection The most common causes for accidental smartphone damage are: dropping your phone on the ground, it falling from a pocket or bag, or it being knocked off a table. The main results of such phone accidents are cracked and scratched screens, followed by chipped corners and sides. In fact, research shows that within 10 weeks of purchase, half of all new phone users will drop their handset. D‚Äôoh! Even a basic phone case will offer some protection against such everyday drops and knocks, and some are built to withstand more catastrophic accidents. A few years ago, such ultra-protective cases meant you‚Äôd be carrying around something the size and weight of a brick, but modern materials mean that protective cases can be relatively slim and light. Clever design and tough-but-thin materials such as Kevlar and Graphene are key to the levels of robustness‚Äîbut it remains the case that the bulkier the case, the more protection it will offer as long as it is also clever and made of the right stuff. Let‚Äôs face it the iPhone is basically made front and back of glass‚Äîeven if it is a new version of Ceramic Shield that Apple claims is ‚Äútwo times tougher than any smartphone glass‚Äù‚Äîand glass dropped on the floor usually ends in despair. Look for raised edges (known as a bezel) around the screen that will protect it from drop cracks and scratches‚Äîit lands on these edges and not the fragile screen. Another point of obvious weakness is the camera lens area, and you should go for a case with a raised edge around that part, too, in case the phone lands that side down. Where we have the exact dimensions, we have included this information in our case reviews below. Look for button covers‚Äîin metal or plastic. Some cases prefer cutouts but may offer less protection as a result. The iPhone 16‚Äôs new Camera Control on the right side of all the iPhone 16 models (except the 16e) is capacitive so it can‚Äôt be covered using standard materials in the same way as the other iPhone buttons can. In its own cases, Apple (and Apple-owned Beats) plus a growing roster of third parties such as OtterBox, ESR, dbrand, Benks and Torras (all reviewed below) utilize a piece of sapphire crystal coupled with a conductive layer to communicate finger movements‚Äîincluding taps, slides and swipes‚Äîto the button below. iPhone 16 case: Style Apple makes the iPhone a thing of sleek beauty and offers a small range of colors (exciting for the iPhone 16 and 16 Plus, but rather dull for the Pro and Pro Max, and black or white 16e). If you want to keep this Apple elegance while still protecting the phone, choose a clear case that won‚Äôt detract from the Apple designers‚Äô art. If you want to add more personality‚Äîif only to distinguish your iPhone from those of your family, friends or colleagues‚Äîthere are hundreds of designs to choose from. Some are quite beautiful, some fine art, and some I wouldn‚Äôt want to be seen with in a dark room. And iPhone 16 cases come in many forms: wallet cases, cases that support bike and car mounts, phone pouches, sleeves, slings and cases with belt-clips. Here we keep adding the best we can find as they come in for testing. iPhone 16 case: Fit Ensure you choose the right case for your exact model so that it fits correctly over the buttons and camera lenses for uninterrupted use. Where possible we have linked to the buying pages for each model: iPhone 16 and 16e (6.1 inch), iPhone 16 Plus (6.7 inch), iPhone 16 Pro (6.3 inch) and iPhone 16 Pro Max (6.9 inch). Don‚Äôt think you can squeeze your new 16 model iPhone into a case for an older model. Sometimes a new iPhone is the same size as the previous model, but not the 16 unfortunately. Upgraders need a new case. iPhone 16 case: magnetic wireless charging Also make sure that the case is MagSafe compatible so that you can charge wirelessly with a MagSafe charger while your iPhone 16 stays in its case. So-called ‚Äúclear‚Äù cases sadly require a huge white ring on their back to be compatible with MagSafe charging. Colored, patterned or leather cases hide their magnets better. The entry-level iPhone 16e surprisingly doesn‚Äôt support MagSafe so this is less of a benefit for that model. You can, of course, still charge via a USB-C cable‚Äîwhich will always be the fastest way to charge an iPhone‚Äîand an iPhone charger. Best clear iPhone cases for iPhone 16, 16e, 16 Plus, 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max If covering up Apple‚Äôs iPhone offends your inner Jony Ive, look for a clear, transparent case that keeps the iPhone‚Äôs looks as wonderful as they were straight out of the box. 1. Apple iPhone 16 Clear Case with MagSafe ‚Äì Best clear iPhone 16 case Pros Made by Apple Shows off iPhone‚Äôs color Cons Basic protection Expensive Price When Reviewed: $49 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price $37 View Deal $37 View Deal $37.99 View Deal $49 View Deal $49 View Deal $49.99 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide View more prices Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $37 at Amazon$37 at Walmart Electronics$37.99 at Best Buy View more prices from AppleApple United StatesTarget Close √ó Best Prices Today: Apple iPhone 16 Clear Case with MagSafe ‚Äì Best clear iPhone 16 case Retailer Price $37 View Deal $37 View Deal $37.99 View Deal $49 View Deal $49 View Deal $49.99 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide View more prices Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 29g Camera edge: 2mm Button covers: Plastic Action button: Covered Camera Control: Covered Colors: Clear Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max This simple, rigid iPhone 16 protective case from Apple is thin and light, and by design, it doesn‚Äôt disguise the color of your iPhone 16 that you chose when you purchased it. Why pick out a Pink or Desert Titanium iPhone 16 Pro Max, only to cover it up in a black plastic case or something with badly drawn flowers on it? With Apple‚Äôs Clear case, you get decent protection without ruining the look of the phone.(If you want a black case or flowery pattern instead of Apple‚Äôs small palette of colors, we have plenty for you to choose from lower down this feature. The Apple Clear Case is made from a blend of optically clear polycarbonate and other flexible materials, with a scratch-resistant coating on both the inside and outside. While it‚Äôs more protective than silicone cases and features a robust-looking 2mm camera lip, you can find tougher cases, which we have reviewed below. There is one part of the case that isn‚Äôt clear‚Äîthe white MagSafe ring on the back. As with all the Apple cases, the Camera Control is covered with a capacitive button that allows for finger taps and gestures without compromising on protection. The bottom of the case is a large cutout, however, leaving the USB-C port, speakers and microphone exposed. At 29g it‚Äôs super light, and while the rigid case adds a little bulk, it‚Äôs worth a little compromise for that layer of protection. All materials and coatings are optimized to prevent yellowing over time. There are also cheaper clear cases, which we have also tested for you. But the Apple badge is a sure sign of quality, as you‚Äôd expect. The colors on the new iPhone 16 Pro and Pro Max models aren‚Äôt as exciting as the iPhone 16 and 16 Plus, though, so we wouldn‚Äôt blame you for deciding on something more joyful. Apple is not yet selling its Clear Case for the entry-level iPhone 16e. 2. ESR Zero Clear Case for iPhone 16 ‚Äì Best budget clear iPhone 16 case Pros Shows off iPhone‚Äôs color Flexible Affordable Cons Basic protection Price When Reviewed: $15.99 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price $7.99 View Deal ESR $15.99 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $7.99 at Amazon$15.99 at ESR MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 27g Raised edge: 1mm Camera edge: 0.7mm Button covers: Plastic Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Clear Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max If you want basic protection for your new iPhone 16, the clear ESR Zero Clear Case has a 1.2mm front edge to protect the screen and a smaller-than-most 0.7mm camera guard. It‚Äôs made from a crystal-clear polymer, which ESR claims resists yellowing for longer than cheaper cases. It is wireless compatible so you don‚Äôt need to flip the case off to charge wirelessly. ESR also makes other less flexible but tougher clear cases, such as the iPhone 16 Air Armor Clear Case with better drop protection and AirGuard corners. The iPhone 16 Pro Classic Hybrid Case has a tough scratch-resistant acrylic back and is available in a Shimmer effect that adds a little more excitement and personality to your average clear case. The iPhone 16 Classic Hybrid Case with Stash Stand, which features military-grade protection and a handy built-in kickstand for stable viewing, is reviewed below. These clear alternatives add a little more weight and cost but are recommended for their extra protection and features. 3. Totallee Super Thin Case for iPhone 16¬†‚Äì Slimmest, lightest hard clear iPhone 16 case Pros Slimmest clear case Lightest case Cons Basic protection MagSafe costs more Price When Reviewed: From $35 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price $35 View Deal Totallee $35 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $35 at Amazon$35 at Totallee MagSafe compatible: Optional Weight: 8g Button covers: Covered Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Clear, Frosted Clear, Frosted Black, Frosted Red, Frosted Green, Frosted Navy Blue Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max This is the slimmest (0.5mm) iPhone 16 case we have tested and‚Äîby a long way‚Äîthe lightest at just 8g. Totallee claims the case weighs 0.2oz, which is 3g but our scales weighed it at 8g, which could just be a failing of our scales. In either case, even 8g is barely noticeable. Even at this weight, there are button covers, and a cutout for the Camera Control. There is a clear version and a similar Frosted Clear model, plus a bunch of other frosted colors to choose from. Note that you have to pay a little more for the MagSafe-compatible versions, which no doubt add a little weight and thickness in parts. 4. ESR iPhone 16 Classic Hybrid Case with Stash Stand¬†‚Äì Best clear iPhone 16 case with stand Pros Shows off iPhone‚Äôs true color Built-in kickstand Cons Heavy Price When Reviewed: $22.99 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price $17.99 View Deal ESR $22.99 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $17.99 at Amazon$22.99 at ESR MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 41g Raised edge: 1.2mm Camera edge: 0.7mm Button covers: Plastic Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout or Covered Colors: Clear, Clear/Black, Clear/Blue, Clear/Pink, Clear/Green, Clear/Gray Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max A more functional clear option is ESR‚Äôs Classic Hybrid Case with Stash Stand, available for all models of the iPhone 16 family. Make sure you choose your exact model. It is transparent, aside from the required giant MagSafe icon, and more affordable than the Apple clear case. The kickstand‚Äîotherwise hidden in the camera ring‚Äîis an added bonus, working in both landscape and portrait modes. The metal stand is an extra camera guard when not in use. ESR even suggests you can use it to carry your iPhone on your finger when your hands are full. If so, you‚Äôll be interested in the protection it offers if it slides off your finger‚Ä¶ There‚Äôs the usual tough talk of military-grade protection, with the case featuring shock-absorbing AirGuard corners and a 0.7mm camera lip. At 40g, it‚Äôs one of the heavier clear cases, which is caused by the handy metal kickstand. An option with covered Camera Control is available, as is one with just a cutout. 5. Casetify clear Impact and Bounce Cases for iPhone 16¬†‚Äì Most customizable clear iPhone 16 case Pros Shows off iPhone‚Äôs true color Protection level options Built-in kickstand option Cons Not entirely transparent Price When Reviewed: From $72 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price Casetify $72 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $72 at Casetify MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 45g Raised edge: 1.4mm Camera edge: 2mm Button covers: Plastic Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Clear Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16e | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max One of our favorite clear options is Casetify‚Äôs Impact and Bounce cases, which are both available for all models of the iPhone 16 family.
